intro: Kohautia sarcophylla, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Kohautia sarcophylla is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
